data.title: Great service
data.text: We had lived in Chattanooga several years ago and returned to run a race.  Porter's excellent service and steaks hadn't changed.  It was an outstanding evening for my wife and I.

data.title: Very nice for hotel restaurant.
data.text: We stayed in the Read house and ate here twice.  Lunch and dinner.  Both very good.  At lunch they were very accommodating for me.  With a limited menu - they made me one of their salads but substituted salmon for the meat (I don't eat red meat - I know - why am I at a steakhouse?!). I ate it all!!  And the night we had dinner there I had salmon again - again food was very good especially see that I was ordering fish in a steakhouse. They didn't get my order right the first time and corrected it promptly.  The waiter forgot that I had ordered a bottled water but I let it slide - we had a party of 24. All those that had steak said they were delicious.

data.title: Food was good.
data.text:
Very relaxing dinner. We had the steak au poivre. The peppercorn seasoning was perfect and the sauce was excellent. The  Pom Frites, fancy for potato wedges, they were very good as well. 
The waitstaff were very friendly.

data.title: the very good is for a hotel dining venue, which are usually average at best
data.text: Stayed in the Read for five nights, dined two nights and two lunches, just conveninece while we were there for a conference. However, the steaks the first night were very very good and the chicke marsala and shrimp scampi the other night were equally good. Cannot say much for any sides, must not have been memorable. Wine list is barely adequate for a steak house, could use about twice as many options, and better options. The service was "interesting", four of five folks were good to very good, with 20% poor. Bar service was very friendly, not necessarily quick, but they loved me and I them. Hard to tell if this is due to work load volume or inefficiency. But, all in all, multiple good meals, and good drinks, in a very nicley decorated restaurant/bar area in hotel without the need to leave the premises.

data.title: Bar review only.
data.text: Not impressed. Ordered an item off the drink menu which clearly stated a certain brand of vodka. I was given a cheaper Svedka (which I don't like) and the drink was not made the way it said on the menu. I watched him. Shaking fruit in a shaker is NOT muddling. I didn't say anything because that's not my style, but it was awful. I drank it anyway. I don't like to waste. Especially vodka. Can't comment on the food, I didn't eat.

data.title: Delicious steaks, spotty service
data.text: My husband and I ate in the restaurant twice during out stay in the Read House hotel. I would give our first experience a mixed review. The steaks were delicious - cooked to our specifications and very flavorful. However, my mashed potatoes were cold, my husband never got the salad he ordered, and the service was poor. Our server seemed distracted, forgetting to refill our water and not taking the time to check back with us.  Our second visit was entirely different. Our waiter was great.  He was friendly, efficient, and very attentive.  I got the champagne scampi and my husband got the chicken marsala. Both were excellent. The restaurant atmosphere is quiet and elegant.  It's pricey, $35 for a steak dinner, but I would recommend it for the delicious food and the atmosphere. If you get a poor waiter, report them to the maitre'd (sp?)

data.title: I have had dinner here before and as always it was top service and food
data.text: Headed for Tivoli Theater in Chattanooga to catch Hal Holbrook doing 'Mark Twain tonight", Porters seemed to be a logical spot for dinner.  I hadn't eaten there in some time and had frankly forgotten how really great the steaks are.. If you are into great service and great steaks, this is certainly to be a primary stop, especially if you are doing the Tivoli Theater.  Dinner was a little pricey but it was a case of convenience and within walkin distance of the Tivoli.  I shall make this a regular dinner spot when making the Tivoli.

data.title: Just slightly disappointed
data.text: On a business outing on a Thursday evening, I did expect a little more from this upscale steakhouse.  The taste of everything for our table of 10 was definitely well received but the service was lack luster and the food came out cold to moderately warm.  Considering the restaurant at 9 pm was relatively empty, one would think that we would be doted on and the food would come out promptly and hot.  It was not enough to intrigue me to visit again unless it was the only thing open at the time.  Missed a great opportunity to have marketing done free of charge on their behalf.

data.title: Average Food for the Price
data.text: If you are staying at the Read, order room service because it is cheaper and you get basically the same menu.  Food was not great and overpriced.  The staff was extremely friendly but that did not offset the poor food quality.

data.title: Elegance and Excellence
data.text: Porter's is not the typical restaurant you find in hotels - this is a fine dining establishment with superior service - the food is fresh and obviously not made in a run of the mill kitchen - I would not recommend it for the budget conscious or family with small children

data.title: Upscale atmosphere with good food
data.text: Come here if you want an upscale atmosphere in a old traditional hotel, with white tablecloths with decent steaks.  The food is good, but not as good as you would expect from the prices.  Equally good steaks could be obtained at other steakhouses for a much less expensive price.  Nice bar with a quality martini. and good selection of bourbons and Scotch  The restaurant is worth a visit for a special occasion or when on a business expense account.

data.title: Good steaks but...
data.text: Good was petty good but they were out of several brews, side items limited, calamari served with yellow sauce not marinara, were slow in bringing appetizers.  Nice atmosphere, just lacking a few things to get a 4th star.  Probably not that way every night.  This was a Thursday.

data.title: Terrible room service
data.text: Porter's provides room service to the Read House Historic Inn and Suites, sort of.  If they are busy, they simply decline to answer the phone until after the time for breakfast has passed and then tell you it's too late.  I finally got room service breakfast, but only because a couple of intrepid front desk workers intervened with the chef, who was also the manage on duty of the hotel at the time.  SMH.

data.title: Business show
data.text: This place is an historic building.  The bar is nice.  Excellent Martini.  The meal was good.  The bread was okay.  Cesar salad was great except there was no fresh ground pepper?  My steak was cooked perfect but had too much salt.  Waitress was very good.

data.title: Great Steak - Reasonably priced
data.text: While staying at the Read House Inn, we saw the steakhouse downstairs and decided to try it. I was surprised at how reasonable the prices were for a steakhouse. I pay more at Morton's for just the sides alone! The filet mignon was excellent and the waiter was very attentive and pleasant. We enjoyed our meal very much, and I would return to Porter's Steakhouse when in Chattanooga again.

data.title: What a let down
data.text: After traveling 11 days on the road staying in seven cities this was by far the worst steakhouse if you could even call it that that I've eaten that. The steak was of poor quality, overcooked and oversalted. When I walked in I thought I walked into a employees lounge due to several people sitting around joking and laughing with dirty dishes laying all over the place. Pretty much a dump from what I saw. I am at the bar which was subpar and the TV was not even near the bar it was off to the left. Not a good experience will not be returning.

data.title: Nice location; average food
data.text:
My husband and a group of our friends go out once a year to a nice restaurant. We all came up from Nashville for the weekend and chose Porters for our "Date" restaurant. We made reservations several weeks in advance, due to our larger (10 guests) group.

The service was fantastic. The waiter was prompt, friendly and efficient (he had a helper). The location was nice being in a historic hotel. 

The food. Eh. It was disappointing. My filet was not cooked to medium like I ordered,  and my husbands strip was overcooked (not med-rare). They were both tasteless. The pom frittes were also a let down (it was more like 2 potato wedges).  The rest of the party wasn't overly impressed with their dishes either. I did sneak one bite of my friend's chocolate dessert (forget the name) and it was quite good. 

Overall, we were all let down in Porters and will not be back on our next trip to Chattanooga.

data.title: GREAT STEAKHOUSE AND SOME HISTORY, ALSO.
data.text:
After driving for several hours, enroute back to Ohio, we opted to overnight in downtown  Chattanooga, so we could visit some of the historic structures the next day.  Little did we know that we would choose to dine in one of them.  Listed in the Historic Register, the Read House Hotel also is home to an extremely fine  dining establishment-Porter's Steakhouse.  Not quite a "Morton's", but in my opinion what Steakhouse is...?  Porter's will give any high-end end Steakhouse a run for their money and end up in the top five of anyone's review.  I had a N.Y. Strip and my wife had a filet.  Both were prepared to our specifications and were very flavorably (is that even a word??) tender.  Can't wait to head back south to dine there again.  May even stay at the Read House-but that would be another review...
...

data.title: Great for a nice, quiet lunch or a business lunch.
data.text: Porters has not only a selection of fine dining but has a $10 lunch special that is fantastic.  Nice, quiet place to eat with friends or business associates.

data.title: Uhhh, the House Restaurant; actually an estaminet, at best.....
data.text: Great location, good service, mid-level menu but, lacking in detail and, for some reason the venue must be on hard times....  Sorry for being a stiff shirt but, the maitre-d' welcomed a man attired in cargo shorts, worn sandals and a pocket Tee for supper seating along with his similar attired woman.... Really, who wishes to view another patrons toe jam and hairy legs for the occasion; attempt at fine dining....  The bar is average in craft and and carriage to create. To cut to the chase, this is a mid-level steak house that has seen better times.  With a new owner in the wings, I am sure the House Restaurant is ready for resurrection....  I know that Chattanooga is prime for that occasion to be fruit.  Hardly anyone from Nooga dines here, other than a post work cocktail.....
